attributes.action: Philip Hammond to withdraw comments on disabled workforce lowering productivity
attributes.background: On the 6.12.17 the chancellor said to MPs at the Treasury Select Committee: "It is almost certainly the case that by increasing participation in the workforce for example of disabled people[...]may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements."
attributes.additional_details:
Rather than scapegoating disabled people through unfounded simplistic claims around a pretty complex matter Mr Hammond would benefit from reading this DWP commissioned report:

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20130314010347/http:/research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd5/rports2005-2006/rrep400.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwj-yP3UlYrYAhVI4KQKHd_mBpc4ChAWCCowAg&usg=AOvVaw3_mgkcqqS4_rwRlzoHoH3N

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect students from universities and letting agencies
attributes.background: Started by a student who has had exposure to injustice in regards to university, letting agencies and landlords. University is stressful as it is, let alone overpaying for a property that isn't fit for purpose. I want to make life bearable for students who want to better themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be illegal for:

- Letting agencies and landlords to let below par properties for high rent.

- Universities who knowingly deliver below par education and still charge high fees.

- Letting agencies and landlords to overcharge student deposits.

One in four students suffer with mental health problems. Students are currently vulnerable and have no protection from the government against these flaws.  Students need to be taken seriously and be seen as the future of this country.

attributes.action: Take the UK out of the EU's Customs Union in 2021 as promised.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned are deeply unhappy that the Government has decided to keep the UK in the Customs Union beyond the Brexit transition/implementation period.
attributes.additional_details: We further reject the use of the Irish Border "problem" as the reason for this decision (the so-called "backstop") and therefore call upon the British Government to immediately reverse this decision and keep its promise to the British people that the UK will be leaving the Customs Union at the end of the transition/implementation period in 2021.

attributes.action: Cancel fees for children born in UK before their parents acquired settlement
attributes.background: Children born in UK whose parents were not settled at the time have to pay £1,012 to register them as British citizens is disproportionate and wrong. Assuming  parents who have three kids before acquiring  settlement or becoming a British citizens have to pay over £3,036.
attributes.additional_details:
HOME OFFICE FEES WITH EFFECT FROM 6 APRIL 2018 FOR CITIZENSHIP APPLICATIONS AND THE RIGHT OF 
ABODE:
CHILDREN
 B(OTA), B(OS) EM, MN1, S2, S3, T.
Child under 18 applying to register as a British citizen 
**An additional £80 per applicant is required to cover the ceremony fee should 
the child turn 18 during the application process. This will be required at point of 
decision.

Fees:£1012

attributes.action: Increase the maintenance loan for all students, regardless of parental income.
attributes.background: The maintenance loan is designed to help students with the cost of living, however for certain students it doesn't even cover accommodation costs as the loan is reduced for those students whose parents have certain incomes. I argue this should be increased to a minimum of £10,000 for all students.
attributes.additional_details: This is because, even if your parents earn £40,000 which is above the £27,000 average salary, they may still be tied into a mortgage and with interest rates rising, they can't just find extra money to fund their children's university living expenses. Therefore, if the maintenance loan was increases to at least £10,000 for all students, those whose parents earn slightly more but don't have a lot more disposable income will not be as disadvantaged and will have improved quality of life.

attributes.action: Cap the price of UK train fares so they are in line with other major economies
attributes.background: I ask the government to consider taking action against the astronomical train fares facing the British public. We pay significantly more than other major global economies. The train should be a cheaper alternative to driving for the sake of the environment and the future of the planet/mankind.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The Independent we spend "six times more on fares than peers in Europe with 14% of our income being spent on monthly season tickets...significantly higher than the 2% seen in France, 3% in Germany and 4% in Spain."

Fullfact.org says "the cost of an annual season ticket covering long-distance travel can exceed £3000, the equivalent of over £1000 more than the next dearest country: the Netherlands. "

attributes.action: Do not remain in the EEA
attributes.background:
Remaining in the EEA will stop the UK becoming the sovereign nation that was voted for in the referendum.
All the promises of new trade deals will become token at best.
Nations outside of the EU has warned against staying in the EU like this and we demand parliament does as was told by the people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/alexander-downer-warns-uk-of-irrelevancy-over-soft-brexit-plans/news-story/c967595695165c994395d81fbb91e100

attributes.action: Give people needing intimate care a right to have it by carers of the same sex
attributes.background: I am concerned that some vulnerable and/or elderly people needing intimate personal care, in their own homes or in care homes are having to suffer the indignity of intimate care several times a day, every day and have no right to refuse to have it carried out by someone of the opposite gender.
attributes.additional_details:
My elderly mother was refused her request to have 2 ladies attend her intimate care by a local care agency.  Luckily for her I was able to assist and ensure the male carer wait in the hall.  
It is not currently a right to have someone of the same gender attend to intimate care.  I think it should be.

attributes.action: If a person uses a vehicle as a weapon they should receive a lifetime ban
attributes.background: If a person gets into a vehicle and ultimately uses that vehicle as a weapon then they should get an automatic lifetime ban from driving on top of any convictions that the courts see fit to administer.
attributes.additional_details:
It is quickly becoming a new trend for people to jump into a vehicle and drive it into a crowd, this is a problem on several fronts including terrorism. 

The courts deal with the criminal aspect by handing out custodial sentences, however when the convicted party leaves prison they are allowed to reapply for a licence or continue driving as the bans handed out are normally spent whilst in prison.

If these offenders were convicted of Animal Cruelty they would receive a lifetime ban.

attributes.action: Make it requirement for takeaways & restaurants to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background: As a country we should enforce ALL places where food is handled to display their food hygiene rating. Food hygiene is crucial and diseases and infections can occur from "poor hygiene" - we as paying customers have the right to know how hygienic our food is respectively.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a known fact that poor food hygiene is associated with serious cases of food poisoning and this could mean having to seek medical evaluation, if you have ever suffered from this you would know it is an unpleasant experience, and it is commonly associated with with pathogens such as Salmonella.
As paying customers we deserve the right to know the standard of hygiene that out food was prepared in respectively. 
This should also motivate those poor establishments to up their standards.

attributes.action: Lower the Voting age to 16
attributes.background:
At 16, UK citizens can do the following:
Get married with consent
Can own property
Can get a job
Can join the army
Pay taxes
Join a trade union
Many 16 year-olds feel that as they contribute to society and the country, they deserve their voices heard as to its political direction and leader.

attributes.action: Legalise a new class of light electric vehicles
attributes.background: Living in a big city, getting around is a major consideration. Public transport is overcrowded, dirty and often inconvenient. Private vehicles are unaffordable and inconvenient. As the UK invests in infrastructure for the alternative, cycling, PEVs which could utilise this continue to be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
As many other countries already do, the UK should embrace the existence of Personal Electric Vehicles (PEVs).

These are small electrically propelled vehicles such as scooters which reach similar speeds to a bicycle with a range of around 20 miles, and unlike bikes are practical enough to be handled like a suitcase when not in use.

With similar regards to electric bikes, legalising PEVs will offer an added green alternative for transportation and allow individuals improved freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Return funding for sixth form students for the last three financial years
attributes.background: The amount £135 million in 2014/15, £132 million in 2015/16 and £106 million in 2016/17 that was not spent would be invaluable in improving the quality of our education, and colleges across England have joined this campaign in order to claim it back.
attributes.additional_details: Unable to provide essential opportunities deprives state educated students the ability to gain crucial skills which more advantaged students in private schools and colleges have already developed. As a result, the social mobility which has been a goal of every recent government is undermined from the start. This means we simply cannot aspire to achieve what our more privileged peers will achieve except in exceptional circumstances.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke within 10 metres of a dwelling if it is hotter than 25C
attributes.background: In the summer, due to global warming, temperatures now regularly reach 30 - 35C. This is extremely hot and it is simply insulting to expect people to not open their windows because inconsiderate people are smoking outside their house.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hugely affected by this issue. Smokers pollute the environment and contribute to global warming. They also severely harm others with second hand smoke, especially children. 
Children are often unable to play in the garden in the summer due to the noxious gases being emitted from the smoke, this causes a deficiency in vitamin D. This law will apply to all areas (public or residential) unless the owner of the properties affected allows them to smoke. Penalty: £400 - 6 months

attributes.action: Change the TV licensing law so that your TV licence covers you away from home.
attributes.background:
If you have a licence and travel on a bus whilst watching iPlayer you are covered. If you live or holiday in a caravan you are covered. 
If you stay in a hotel, B&B or holiday home you ARE NOT and require the owner of that establishment to have a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
You could be potentially breaking the law without even realising it.
I am one of those many law abiding citizens who have to work away from home due to lack of suitable work in my home area. I own a TV licence at home. During the week I rent a cottage off my employer. I have no utility bills, do not have the right to vote in this constituency and I am not registered with a GP here and yet I am required, by law, to have a TV licence - Why?
If you think that this should be changed please vote.

attributes.action: Revoke all Diplomatic and Economic ties with South Africa
attributes.background: Due to the actions of the current ANC leadership, I would like to see the same type of action taken as was put in place against the National Party in the 70’s and 80’s. The ANC needs to be put under pressure for the welfare of ALL South Africans.

attributes.action: Make it an offence for people who park in parent & child spaces without child
attributes.background: Having a child myself when out and about is stressful enough. When you come to park your car in parent & child space it would be nice not to see so many people using the spaces that are reserved for people who have children.
attributes.additional_details:
This morning I witnessed 3 different cars parked in the parent and child spaces after I drove round for 5 minutes trying to find one. Eventually I saw a lone lady get into her car who didn’t have a child. She eventually pulled out the space and whilst I was unloading the pushchair, the car that was parked next to me, had four adults walk to it and get in.
It’s extremley useful to have the extra space either side of the car when you have a car seat to get out.

attributes.action: Make those with registered assistance dogs automatically eligible for PIP.
attributes.background: According to the Governments own website PIP should be paid to those who are financially penalised because of there disability or long term illness. Many people with assistance dogs actually get turned down for PIP because of the dog and the help they give, this is not right and needs to change.

attributes.action: Remove Widows Parents Allowance as an income on Universal Credit Claims
attributes.background: Universal Credit claims currently see Widows Parents Allowance as an income. Therefore any claim made by a widow is penalised resulting in the total amount of Widows Parents Allowance being deducted from their claim resulting in a far lesser payment of Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Widows Parents Allowance is exactly that, an allowance to help a widowed parent support and provide for their young children following the loss of the child's/children's parent.
I alone will not be able to make changes to the Universal Credit criteria, but feel strongly that the inclusion of Widows Parents Allowance in any Universal Credit claim should be reconsidered. Support should be given by our Government to those trying to better themselves following the devastating loss of a husband/wife

attributes.action: NHS access should not be part of any trade negotiations with any foreign power.
attributes.background: The NHS, since its coming into being in 1948 has been a, perhaps THE,  social cement even in times of national division. It is an institution that is for the people and of the people and should be protected as our prime national asset.
attributes.additional_details: Poll upon poll has shown the depth of feeling the British people have for the NHS.  Most recently. 60,000 marched in defence of the Service.

attributes.action: Parents should have the right to choose who looks after their children.
attributes.background: Parents do not have the right to pay a trusted friend to look after their children.
attributes.additional_details: For low earners without family around them, and with childcare costs so high, a lot of parents end up having to work night shifts so the other parent can look after the children. Not a healthy situation for any family!

attributes.action: Prevent false cures for autism being sold to people in the UK
attributes.background: I am concerned about the number of parents being tricked into giving their children bleach solutions, often marketed as MMS (Miracle Mineral solutions), as an autism cure. It can lead to severe injuries or death. I urge the government to prevent the sale of false cures.
attributes.additional_details: Autism cannot be cured and this practice is seeing serious injuries to children, and may result in deaths. Turps and bleach have their place as cleaners, but as doctors have stated "Chlorine dioxide causes abdominal cramps, vomiting and diarrhoea. If you drink it on a long-term basis it causes inflammation of your gut-lining, stomach, oesophagus and intestines and eventually death" https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/brit-kids-forced-drink-bleach-11924623

attributes.action: Buy British made Mechanised Infantry Vehicles for the army
attributes.background: Britain currently has a major trade deficit, especially in manufactured goods. the country's engineering capability and capacity has been severely degraded over the past thirty years, in part because of successive refusals by the British government to support and encourage manufacturing in Britain.

attributes.action: Introduce owner-funded dog DNA register so that Councils can fine owners easier.
attributes.background: Dog fouling is the blight of Britain.Whilst Councils have powers to enforce legislation most don't have the manpower to do this away from town centres. A DNA register would allow a much more efficient prosecution process. People have the right to walk without looking at their feet.
attributes.additional_details: DNA registration is relatively cheap, and economies of scale with a national database would reduce the costs further. This cost would be the responsibility of the owner, and a legal requirement to have a dog DNA registered. Due to the amount of dog fouling, especially on open public spaces away from Wardens/Police, there is very little chance of anyone being fined for letting their dog foul, or picking it up but throwing their dog bag into the hedge.

attributes.action: Ban working MPs and donors of over £5,000 to a political party from honours.
attributes.background: Implementing this ban will reduce the chances of people using their position to get honours, reduce corruption and help those who truly deserve honours receive them.
attributes.additional_details:
Working MPs are a special case compared to working musicians, sportsmen etc. 

Only MPs have the ability to directly affect the government that is in power and the laws within which we all live under and therefore require special rules.

Wealthy people should not use their money to influence a democratically elected government.

attributes.action: To make it a legal human right for every UK citizen to have a home.
attributes.background: Homelessness is increasing, human beings should not be living on the streets in the 21st Century. The United Kingdom is a first world country and as a civilised advanced country we should no longer tolerate homelessness for any reason.

attributes.action: Provide financial help for victims of domestic violence
attributes.background:
Give them the freedom to escape their situation without having to worry about the financial repercussions. Even if they own their own homes there should be support since often they would have been financially dependent on their abuser.
Freedom to escape without facing potential homelessness
attributes.additional_details: There is no financial help for people with a mortgage, even if they cant afford to pay the mortgage, have no job and no income. Temporary help would give people that safety net they need to have the courage to leave an abusive relationship without having to worry about becoming homeless. The housing register rejects applicants based on a tick box saying yes i have a mortgaged property - it takes months to sell a house and everyone deserves to have a safe home to live in.

attributes.action: Pay reparations to Caribbean descendants of slavery.
attributes.background: The British government owes Caribbean people reparations for the horrors carried out on black people during slavery. The sugar cane plantations helped to fund many cooperations still in existence today, these families cam be traced and great Britain should be held accountable for its atrocities.

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: Make tax incentives and laws for companies allowing people to work  from home.
attributes.background: Because a lot of people travel into work in cities we are overloading the traffic infrastructure, creating pollution. parking problems and destroying country villages. Give companies incentives to allow them to support home workers, remove laws making companies for being responsible for home areas.
attributes.additional_details: companies are made responsible for the environment that people are working in at home, allow workers to opt out of this protection so they can work at home. Companies should only be responsible for the computers and equipment they supply nothing else. this will allow people with children to work from home. also companies can use more part time workers.

attributes.action: Allow voluntary Lie Detector Tests in criminal trials for both victims & accused
attributes.background: I’m a crime victim & have experienced the horrific tactics adopted by defence barristers determined to get perpetrators off regardless of guilt. I propose, in the interest of fairness, that both accused & victims can voluntarily submit to lie detector tests & that this evidence can be used at trial.
attributes.additional_details:
Lie detectors are now used on convicted sex offenders to manage risk, but not allowed in criminal trials. The guilty walk free as juries are often reluctant to convict. Lie detectors, offered to both sides, should be allowed as partial evidence 
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/02/16/liedetectorshave-used-send-160-sex-offenders-back-prison/
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/britains-hostility-to-lie-detector-tests-misguided-and-irrational-says-leading-psychologist-10349313.html

attributes.action: Ensure the Windrush generation can exercise their right to vote.
attributes.background: People affected by the Windrush debacle have had every right that UK citizens take for granted, including the right to vote. Now that the citizenship issue is being resolved, it is only right and proper to ensure they can exercise their right to vote.

attributes.action: Please remove age restriction in s3(5) of the British Nationality Act
attributes.background: Our son was denied an application to register as a British citizen because he had just turned 18, and informed by Home Office that his only path to citizenship was settlement / ILR (£2389 + Life in UK test £50) followed by naturalisation (£1330 + £20 for biometrics + £80 citizenship ceremony).
attributes.additional_details: Please remove the age restriction to register as a British citizen in section 3(5) birth abroad to parents who are British by descent but now domiciled in UK. Why does the entitlement under British Nationality law end upon reaching the age of 18? Article 8 / Human Rights Act 1998 and UN Declaration on Human Rights state inter alia "The family is the natural and fundamental group unit of society and is entitled to protection by society and the State."

attributes.action: Ban horse racing
attributes.background: Horses are whipped and forced to run around tracks that are often made of hard-packed dirt at speeds of more than 30 miles per hour while carrying people on their backs. Racehorses are the victims of a multibillion-dollar industry that has problems with drug abuse, injuries and race fixing.
attributes.additional_details: When they stop winning races or become injured, some owners don’t want to pay for a horse who doesn’t bring in any money. Many end up in slaughterhouses where they are turned into dog food and glue. They may endure days of transport in tiny trailers where there is no access to water, food and injuries are common. Horses tend to thrash about in order to avoid being shot by the gun, which is supposed to render them unconscious before their throats are cut.

attributes.action: Allow police to confiscate mobile phones when drivers are caught using them.
attributes.background: Fining drivers for mobile phone use appears to be of little deterrent on its own. A fine along with points on the license and immediate confiscation could possibly have more impact. The inconvenience and cost of losing all personal contacts and data would, for some people, be immeasurable.
attributes.additional_details: Lincolnshire recently had a blitz on catching drivers using mobile phones, as far as I can see that made absolutely no difference. I see the same people day in day out driving while using hand held mobile phones, that includes tractor drivers.

attributes.action: Allow on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights.
attributes.background: Allowing on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights would make them more noticeable to other vehicles. This would help minimise delays while they are trying to get to their respective station. Delays cost lives!
attributes.additional_details: Green flashing lights can currently be used by doctors. These lights don't give any exemption to traffic laws, but do highlight the importance of the journey. This means that vehicles are more likely to let them past than if they had no lighting.

attributes.action: Change planning laws. Everyone should have a say and be heard.
attributes.background: If a local resident affected by a planning application requests a meeting, planning officers and councillors must meet them to discuss their concerns before a decision is made. Council officers discuss planning applications for months with developers and their army of planning consultants.
attributes.additional_details: They must talk to us as well. The current situation is fundamentally undemocratic and wrong. A developer made a planning application for a supermarket down my little street. There is no parking, huge lorries will make deliveries and we were concerned our tiny road would not be big enough. Nobody in planning would listen to us. Elected councillors refused to discuss the planning application. My objection comments went unread: I was denied a voice: I was silenced.

attributes.action: Bring Back Capital Punishment For Convicted Terrorists.
attributes.background:
Over 30 lives have been claimed in attacks in the UK since 2016 which has left the UK terrified.
Anyone that performs terrorist attacks against the UK should be faced with capital punishment once proven guilty.
Many citizens of the UK feel a life sentence in prison isn't enough to satisfy justice.

attributes.action: Have GMT all year round.
attributes.background:
An extra hour in bed every day for six months of the year.

The correct time for our longitude.

attributes.action: Regulate supported housing and hostels.
attributes.background: We need a regulatory body to license and oversee hostels and supported housing, including checking that support workers are trained, checking that licence agreements are fair, and offering a fair and impartial complaints procedure. Currently, owners get away with treating vulnerable adults unfairly.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people can find it difficult to understand their rights and make complaints. Proper regulation would mean that vulnerable people would be protected without having to fight to be treated fairly. I have been discriminated against and there was nothing I could do about it. A housing charity evicted me for not engaging enough, even though I have a severe anxiety disorder and another didn't deal with a complaint fairly and wasn't impartial.

attributes.action: Do not impose same-sex marriage on religious minorities
attributes.background: We call on Parliament, now and in the future, to continue to uphold the fundamental human right of religious minorities (Christians, Muslims, Jews and others) not to have same-sex marriage imposed on us, as guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013.
attributes.additional_details:
The right of religious minorities not to have same-sex marriage imposed on them was guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ which was included in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013 when same-sex marriage was legalized in the UK.

We call on Parliament to continue to uphold and respect this fundamental human right.

We remind Parliament that one of its key functions in a democratic society is to protect minorities from the ‘tyranny of the majority.’

attributes.action: Changes required under the Universal Credit to support workers!
attributes.background:
make uploading documentation for childcare costs or any other evidence available online - this will enable working families to upload in a timely manner!

monies to be paid in advance for childcare costs as ALL nurseries UK wide require advance payment!!
attributes.additional_details: I am a single mother to 2 under 3's who works as a manager but is newly single and having to rely on a system whether the childcare costs and housing costs have not been paid for the last 2 months leaving me in a very difficult situation that nobody else (IN WORK) SHOULD GO THROUGH!

attributes.action: Stop introducing fixed tenancies to tenants
attributes.background: New legislation is putting forward that fixed term tenancies will be given to everyone who is signing a new tenancy. This means tenants with existing secure tenancies will loose their secure tenancy example through mutual exchange and through the bidding system.
attributes.additional_details: Tenants are given opportunity to move through mutual exchange and being forced to give up their secure tenancy because they need extra space or to downsize. Now it’s a choice of quality of living or a secure tenancy. With these new laws coming in no one is secure people with vulnerability should be excempt from these laws. It would be better that those who need to move through mutual exchange should keep their existing tenancy status ie secure tenancy and move that over to the swapper property.

attributes.action: Re-run the appointments process for the board of the Office for Students
attributes.background: The Commissioner for Public Appointments has identified serious governance failings and political interference in the appointment of board members of the new Office for Students. All board members should be asked to immediately resign and the appointments process be re-run in  proper manner.
attributes.additional_details: The full report of the Commissioner can be accessed here: https://publicappointmentscommissioner.independent.gov.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Commissioner-for-Public-Appointments-Investigation-OFS-Final-.pdf

attributes.action: Amend the Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: This was first suggested in July 2016 following a mixed breed Staffie mixed type dog nearly killing my Border Terrier. Only 66 people at that time signed it, so this time round it should get a better result.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the high number of dog attacks on sheep, and people as well as other canines, the aim is to have all dog owners and dog homes must have every dog’s DNA taken and registered on a database with their microchip. This would allow all dogs to be screened when attacks happen to find the owners.  Wounds can be swabbed and detection made, not only during injury investigation or th of sheep, but also for banned breeds!  
The DNA could also assist District Council to check samples of uncollected poo in order to trace owners and prosecute them.

attributes.action: Provide help for residents of Tawergha in Libya
attributes.background: There are around 35,000 people (who are an ethnic minority) who have been forced to leave their homes in the 2011 revolution by militias from Misrata. The UN-backed Tripoli Government promised their return to Tawargha on the 1st of February 2018, after 7 years of living in bad conditions.
attributes.additional_details: The militias have refused this government decision and blocked the roads to Tawergha by force. Now the people of Tawergha have built make-shift camps in Gararat Al-Gadaf which is near Bin Walid and Harawa which is near Sirte. On 5/02/2018 militias from Mistrata attacked the camp and burned some tents. On 12/02/2018 two people passed away and some children were admitted to Bin Walid hospital due to exposure to the cold. I am asking the British Government to provide assistance to these civilians.

attributes.action: The penalty for using a mobile phone while driving  1year ban and £500 fine.
attributes.background: Too many people are being injured and killed on our roads the present penalties are not a deterrent. Too many people are ignoring the issue.

attributes.action: Form a public holiday to celebrate our NHS; incl. all in the emergency services
attributes.background:
The NHS is one of our key British Values.

A NHS Day holiday in the summer would serve to underscore our deep admiration for all of those who work in the health and emergency services. With events celebrating its formation, those that serve and events to promote health and community.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is, if anything, one of our key British Values. Given this, is it not time to truly celebrate the NHS!?!?
This would allow a focus of public opinion and need for such a critical part of who we are as a nation, showing the world that this is who we are and what we hold dearest to our hearts. If ever there was a time to show how strong we all feel about the NHS it's now. What better way to do that than a public holiday focused around celebrating this bedrock of our society!

attributes.action: Raise income tax by 0.25%, ring-fenced for NHS and post-discharge social care.
attributes.background:
The NHS is at crisis point with A&E having patients in all corners and in a queue of ambulances outside It needs extra money to provide for good quality services and the type of social care that would help to stop bed blocking in hospitals.

Waiting lists for clinics  and tests are too long.
attributes.additional_details:
Most people I know would be prepared to pay more income tax as long as it is used as extra money for the NHS and social care to enable discharge from hospital when nursing is no longer needed.

Doctor and nurse staff morale is low because of the pressures in trying to care for sick people without the resources to do so.

Bed occupancy is at 94% in England which is not entirely due to influenza as elective surgery was cancelled to cover this. The NHS could not cope with a further crisis.
